erm, odd. Try pastebin.ca

ok, run this line, see what happens: sudo lrm-manager --kver=2.6.22-14-generic
segmentation fault

ok, I worry a bit about this fix, but you could try it: gksudo nano /var/lib/dpkg/info/linux-restricted-modules-2.6.22-14-generic.postinst , add exit 0 to line 2, save, exit, run the install, immediately uninstall, reboot, reinstall
you might run into an issue during the uninstall, that's why I'm uncertain. It would be fixable, however
it installed fine now, so uninstall it?
immediately
--purge autoremove it be fine?
aptitude purge is my preference
when uninstally it removes package linux, will I be able to reboot
linux-image , that package?
no just 'linux' and other restricted modules packages
as long as it doesn't remove linux-image-2.6.22-14-generic, you'll be fine
sorry internet disconnected, i'll be right to reboot?
as long as you didn't uninstall  linux-image-2.6.22-14-generic, you'll be fine
